div.p: Orange County students will lead the nation in college and career readiness and success.

div.div:
​​
​​​​​​​To support social distancing during the COVID-19 crisis, OCDE has closed its offices to the public and asked employees to work remotely if possible. We are checking voicemail and emails daily and will do our best to reply within 24 to 48 hours. For the latest developments rela​​ted to COVID-19, visit the​ OCDE Newsroom.
​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​​
​ ​​ ​
Video Transcript
​​​Flattening the Curve
Public health experts say minimizing social contact during a pandemic can effectively slow the spread of a virus so communities aren’t hit by a large wave of illnesses all at once. The concept, called “flattening the curve,” is explained above.​
​
​
​Strategic Plan 2016-19
OCDE’s vision that Orange County students will lead the nation in college and career readiness and success is outlined, along with eight strategic priorities and key performance indicators.​
Orange County Public Schools Directory​
View the online version, or contact Media Services for a printed version.​

​As school districts across Orange County pivot to distance learning models in real time, OCDE’s Educational Services division has developed a cache of online resources for educators, counselors and families.​

​The California B​oard of Education recently approved a new Health Education Framework for public schools, providing optional guidance for K-12 teachers based on the state’s health education standards.
​Recognizing the importance of an accurate population count for schools and communities, OCDE is among a number of organizations working to raise awareness in advance of the 2020 census.​​
​OCDE supports student achievement through high-quality training opportunities for teachers, administrators and support staff.
​Educational options in Orange County include high quality charter schools that emphasize rigorous academic standards, innovative programs and responsible business practices.
​The following public notices are posted for informational purposes for Orange County community members.​​
div.hr:
​
Calendar of Events
​Check out the latest events, workshops, trainings and activities coming up at OCDE.
​Orange County Board of Education Meeting Agenda
Agendas for upcoming Orange County Board of Education meetings are posted at least 72 hours before each session.​

img.alt: VSA Festival goes virtual to celebrate the artistic accomplishments of individuals with disabilities
img.p: VSA Festival goes virtual to celebrate the artistic accomplishments of individuals with disabilities

div.p: Every year around this time, OCDE and VSA Orange County team up to spotlight the artistic achievements of individuals with disabilities. The VSA Festival is a free, daylong event that’s typically held at MainPlace Mall in Santa Ana on a Saturday in April. But California’s stay-at-home directive and national social distancing measures mean the 44th […]

img.alt: COVID-19 update: County Supt. Al Mijares offers words of encouragement to parents, teachers and staff
img.p: COVID-19 update: County Supt. Al Mijares offers words of encouragement to parents, teachers and staff

div.p: OCDE continues to track the latest developments related to the COVID-19 respiratory illness while working closely with partner agencies including the Orange County Health Care Agency and local school districts. Here are additional sources for updated information: California Coronavirus (COVID-19) Response Resources for instructional continuity Child care for essential workers Orange County closures and grab-and-go […]

img.alt: Educators, community step in to build face shields for COVID-19 first responders
img.p: Educators, community step in to build face shields for COVID-19 first responders

div.p: Across the region, scores of first responders are on the front lines of the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, working to save lives and maintain valuable services. Behind the scenes is also a strong network of supporters, including volunteers who are supplying first responders with valuable tools. Kyo Pineda, Title I program supervisor in OCDE’s ACCESS program, […]

img.alt: Saddleback Church teams up with OCDE to provide meals, groceries for OC families
img.p: Saddleback Church teams up with OCDE to provide meals, groceries for OC families

div.p: April showers didn’t discourage the families who lined up in their cars to pick up boxes of food outside OCDE’s offices in Santa Ana. And the rain certainly didn’t deter the team of volunteers from Saddleback Church. On Thursday, 234 families were served groceries by Saddleback Church and their volunteers at the Orange County Department […]
